comments.html: Maybe cisco thought NBAR was a better choice to perform session tracking? Do you also get full NBAR stats reporting?
comments.name: Michael Gonnason

comments.html:
@rawcode: No, you have to enable NBAR on individual interfaces to get protocol discovery running.

@richard: You cannot disable NBAR as long as NAT is configured.
comments.name: Ivan Pepelnjak

comments.html: My thoughts on this was application fixup. A number of protocols (active FTP, DNS, SQLNET, RTSP and others) either embed IP addresses or do port changes, which NAT would have to detect and fixup. A quick google found this cisco doc,  http://tinyurl.com/64m9sr, which indicates that Application Level Gateways are used. It wouldn't surprise me if ALGs use NBAR to do its dirty work.
comments.name: Anonymous
